byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo reported from Washington, and Monica Davey from Chicago.
byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and MONICA DAVEY

abstract: Officials from Ferguson, Mo, and Justice Dept reach tentative deal to implement police department changes and avoid civil rights lawsuit on questionable policing surrounding 2014 death of Michael Brown; Mayor James Knowles III acknowledges city taxes must go up to support costs of changes and city officials hope to pass tax increase by end of January.
lead_paragraph: The deal would head off a civil rights lawsuit over police practices in the Missouri city that erupted in protests after the death of a black teenager, Michael Brown.

headline.main: Ferguson Nears Deal With Justice Dept. to Overhaul Police Force
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Nears Agreement With U.S. on Police Tactics
